text:
PLACEMENT SERVICE, MAY, 1955: PAGE 6
supervisor for educational television station. Harvard educated, wide experience
in newspaper work, radio, TV and films, here and abroad. Recipient of Nieman
Fellowship. Married, aged 40, prepared to relocate for long-range opportunity.
May 49. Young ambitious man, with a Radio Telephone License, desires a position
with your T. V. Studio. Diversified background in Production, Staging and Light¬
ing Techniques, also specialized in camera and control room operation. Salary
open. AVAILABLE IMMEDIATELY.
May 50..Director of Public Service and Educational Programs for Midwest commercial
television station seeks position as Program Director for educational station.
Holds Doctor of Education degree in Educational Foundations and is former college
instructor. Over ten years’ experience in Education and Teaching. Experience
in theatre and dramatics activities. Television experience consists of two
years as producer and director of public service and educational productions plus
first-hand knowledge of studio operation. Complete details of background and
experience upon request.
May 51. I am an Elementary School Teacher interested in securing an administrative,
guidance or supervisory position in your school system beginning next September.
At the end of this year I will have successfully completed six years teaching
experience on the elementary level, having taught all the grades from one to
eight and combinations of the same. My experience ranges from the one room school
to the modem ranch type structure I am teaching in at the present time. Age 31,
married, two children, veteran. MA degree in Educational Administration and
Guidance. Fully licensed. Personal interview will be appreciated.
May 52. Assistant professor with twelve years teaching experience desires position
in creative television programming. In fifth year of continuous television pro¬
duction of award winning programming. Familiar with all phases of production,
photography (still and motion) art-work, narration, hosting and writing. Academic
rank desirable but not essential.
May 53«. Script writer, 26, female, 3 years experience commercial radio, seeks
educational affiliation. B.S. in journalism, P. G. work in education, member
AWRT and DAVI. Prefer east or middle west.
May 54* SITUATION WANTED: Young woman, 27, wTith BA and MA from Stanford University
in theatre, production and TV; teaching certification and experience; radio, TV,
and.stage background. Available for position in Educ. TV: prod., directing,
script or research. Ideas. New station or established. Salary open.
May 55. Long record of success in curriculum-building, school station operation
and production of radio and television programs. Interested in a position of
responsibility where maturity and experience count. Combines educational and
commercial experience.
May 56* Trained in TV and Film, experienced film technician, many years of office
experience in several fields including motion pictures, managerial and super¬
visory capacities.
May.57# Network television producer, director, writer, with five years in tele¬
vision, and seven years in related media, seeks executive producer position
with educational television station.
